meanings.definition: Sewing over the edge of fabric to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to do oversewing to stop my fabric from unraveling.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used oversewing to secure the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The oversewing on the scarf kept it from turning into a mess of threads.
meanings.sent4: Her oversewing was like a protective shield against the wear and tear of time.
meanings.sent5: The oversewing technique was like a magic spell that kept everything in place.

meanings.definition: The act of stitching over the edge of a book to reinforce the binding.
meanings.sent1: The oversewing of the book made it sturdy and durable.
meanings.sent2: Librarians often use oversewing to extend the life of well-loved books.
meanings.sent3: The oversewing on the novel made it feel like a fortress of words.
meanings.sent4: His oversewing was a silent promise to protect the stories within.
meanings.sent5: The oversewing was the book's armor against the passage of time.

meanings.definition: A method of finishing the edges of a seam by sewing over them.
meanings.sent1: Her oversewing of the seam gave it a neat and polished look.
meanings.sent2: The designer's attention to detail was evident in the precise oversewing.
meanings.sent3: The oversewing on the dress seam was like adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: The oversewing transformed the rough edges into a seamless finish.
meanings.sent5: With oversewing, even the simplest seam can look professionally done.
